**Objectives**

This course aims to equip pre-service teachers with competence in designing quality inquiry-based curriculum. Students will learn principles of 1) concept-based instruction and 2) International Baccalaureate (IB) education, which are believed to enrich their professionals in developing student-centered instruction. Students will discuss how to unpack IB philosophy curriculum guidelines, set educational aims for students, design and organize relevant learning activities and resources, and design and implement proper assessments. They will demonstrate their understanding of the IB curriculum design through presentations during the course.

**Grade Distribution**

Category

Weighting

Description

1\. UbD Unit

30%

Construct a UbD lesson plan. Requirements:

1\. Redesign one of your existing lessons (or you can create a new one)

2\. Design a 4-6 hrs unit using a UbD planner, with special attentions to inquiry questions and assessment designs (summative assessment)

3\. Present the one lesson in the unit design, including Generalization(s), Guiding questions, Web strands and related critical content and key skills, Assessment, description of learning experiences including learning resources/materials/activities.

2\. IBMYP Unit Plan

30%

Construct an IBMYP unit plan. Requirements:

1\. Select a topic that runs 20 hours.

2\. Draft a unit using MYP unit planner; consult the IBMYP framework that is indicated in Subject Guide.

3\. TOK Unit Design

20%

Each team (2-3 ppl) needs to create a ToK unit that is addressed in self-selected disciplinary topic. Students need to consider nature of the subject they teach and then create a 1-hr activity that develops critical thinking within the subject. Each group will need to do a 15-20-min teaching demonstration which guides students to think or inquire with adequate knowledge questions and activities.

4\. Moodle Responses

20%

Students will need to complete in-class tasks set in Moodle or face-to-face class. Reflective journals and responses to peers are highly encouraged.
